results.title: Effect of methylene blue treatment on amlodipine toxicity-induced myocardial depression.

results.title: Severe Amlodipine Toxicity: A Case Rescued with Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation
results.text_hl: We present a case of a 28-year-old female known case of @DISEASE_Epilepsy @DISEASE_MESH:D004827 @@@seizure disorder@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ who got admitted to our hospital with a history of consumption of 80 tablets of 5 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (total 400 mg).

citations.NLM: Sutar A, Venkategowda PM, Murthy A, Chikkaswamy SB. Severe Amlodipine Toxicity: A Case Rescued with Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation Indian J Crit Care Med. 2020 May;24(5):365-366. PMID: 32728332
citations.BibTeX: @article{32728332, title={Severe Amlodipine Toxicity: A Case Rescued with Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation}, author={Sutar A and Venkategowda PM and Murthy A and Chikkaswamy SB}, journal={Indian J Crit Care Med}, volume={24}, number={5}, pages={365-366}}

results.title: Preoperative Amlodipine Is Efficacious in Preventing Intraoperative HDI in Pheochromocytoma: Pilot RCT.
results.text_hl: One @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ had intraoperative @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@ST depression@@@ on the electrocardiogram.

results.title: Antihypertensive Drugs and Risk of Depression: A Nationwide Population-Based Study.
results.text_hl: Individual drugs associated with decreased @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ included 2 of 16 angiotensin agents: @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@; 3 of 10 calcium antagonists: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ combinations; and 4 of 15 beta-blockers: @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@.

citations.NLM: Kessing LV, Rytgaard HC, Ekstrøm CT, Torp-Pedersen C, Berk M, Gerds TA. Antihypertensive Drugs and Risk of Depression: A Nationwide Population-Based Study. Hypertension. 2020 Oct;76(4):1263-1279. PMID: 32829669
citations.BibTeX: @article{32829669, title={Antihypertensive Drugs and Risk of Depression: A Nationwide Population-Based Study.}, author={Kessing LV and Rytgaard HC and Ekstrøm CT and Torp-Pedersen C and Berk M and Gerds TA}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={76}, number={4}, pages={1263-1279}}

results.title: Amlodipine overdose complicated by non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema and diffuse alveolar hemorrhage: A case report
results.text_hl: A young adult female presented with @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depressed mental status@@@ after intentional @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@ of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Bringgold WR, Long MT. Amlodipine overdose complicated by non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema and diffuse alveolar hemorrhage: A case report Saudi J Anaesth. 2022 Jan-Mar;16(1):104-107. PMID: 35261597
citations.BibTeX: @article{35261597, title={Amlodipine overdose complicated by non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema and diffuse alveolar hemorrhage: A case report}, author={Bringgold WR and Long MT}, journal={Saudi J Anaesth}, volume={16}, number={1}, pages={104-107}}

results.title: Psychological Continuum of Elderly Patients Suffering from Arterial Hypertension with Metabolic Syndrome, Against the Background of Chronotherapy with a Fixed Combination of Amlodipine, Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin.
results.text_hl: The situational @DISEASE_Anxiety @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@ score decreased from 40.0+-2.2 to 30.6+-1.8 (r<0.05) and from 40.8+-2.5 to 33.5+-1.9  (r<0.05), and the trait @DISEASE_Anxiety @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@ score decreased from 48.8+-2.0 to 26.4+-1.9 (r<0.001) and from 44.9+-1.9 to 30.7+-1.7  (r<0.01) with the evening and morning dosing, respectively. @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@Depressive disorders@@@ slightly decreased with the chronotherapy by 14.1 % vs. 7.7 % with the traditional regimen; nevertheless, they were consistent with @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depressive spectrum disorders@@@ in both groups.Conclusion            The study results showed a higher effectiveness of the chronotherapeutic treatment compared to the traditional treatment with FC of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ in @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@arterial hypertension@@@ with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Agarkov NM, Okhotnikov OI, Korneeva SI, Moskaleva EO, Moskalev AA, Kolomiets VI, Markelova AM, Markelova EA. Psychological Continuum of Elderly Patients Suffering from Arterial Hypertension with Metabolic Syndrome, Against the Background of Chronotherapy with a Fixed Combination of Amlodipine, Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin. Kardiologiia. 2021 Mar 30;61(3):36-41. PMID: 33849417
citations.BibTeX: @article{33849417, title={Psychological Continuum of Elderly Patients Suffering from Arterial Hypertension with Metabolic Syndrome, Against the Background of Chronotherapy with a Fixed Combination of Amlodipine, Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin.}, author={Agarkov NM and Okhotnikov OI and Korneeva SI and Moskaleva EO and Moskalev AA and Kolomiets VI and Markelova AM and Markelova EA}, journal={Kardiologiia}, volume={61}, number={3}, pages={36-41}}

results.title: Monotherapy with amlodipine or atenolol versus their combination in stable angina pectoris.
results.text_hl: During ambulatory monitoring, @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ regarding total time and number of @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@ST-depression@@@ episodes, and as effective as the combined drugs.

citations.NLM: Pehrsson SK, Ringqvist I, Ekdahl S, Karlson BW, Ulvenstam G, Persson S. Monotherapy with amlodipine or atenolol versus their combination in stable angina pectoris. Clin Cardiol. 2000 Oct;23(10):763-70. PMID: 11061055
citations.BibTeX: @article{11061055, title={Monotherapy with amlodipine or atenolol versus their combination in stable angina pectoris.}, author={Pehrsson SK and Ringqvist I and Ekdahl S and Karlson BW and Ulvenstam G and Persson S}, journal={Clin Cardiol}, volume={23}, number={10}, pages={763-70}}

results.title: Effect of nifedipine and amlodipine on dead space wound healing in rats.
results.text_hl: Effect of two calcium channel blockers (CCBs) @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, was studied on normal and @CHEMICAL_Steroids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013256 @@@steroid@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depressed@@@ wound healing in albino @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, using the dead space wound model.

citations.NLM: Bhaskar HN, Udupa SL, Udupa AL. Effect of nifedipine and amlodipine on dead space wound healing in rats. Indian J Exp Biol. 2005 Mar;43(3):294-6. PMID: 15816421

results.title: Clinical safety and efficacy of once-a-day amlodipine for chronic stable angina pectoris.
results.text_hl: The antiischemic effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ were evident; there was an increase in exercise tolerance and a reduction of ST-segment @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@, as seen in the 24-hour after-dose (range 23 to 30 hours) exercise tread-mill test.

citations.NLM: Glasser SP, West TW. Clinical safety and efficacy of once-a-day amlodipine for chronic stable angina pectoris. Am J Cardiol. 1988 Sep 15;62(9):518-22. PMID: 2970788
citations.BibTeX: @article{2970788, title={Clinical safety and efficacy of once-a-day amlodipine for chronic stable angina pectoris.}, author={Glasser SP and West TW}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={62}, number={9}, pages={518-22}}
